definition[0]: a noticeable difference from what is expected or acceptable
definition[1]: the difference between a number or measurement in a set  and the average of all the numbers or measurements in that set
example[1]: Any deviation in the current inflation rate could send stocks sharply up or down.
example[2]: The sudden rise in market prices was an unexpected deviation from the norm.
definition[2]: a difference between a number or measurement in a set and the average of all the numbers or measurements in that set
